publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5152# Cathy Peattie: Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions—That the Parliament congratulates Central Scotland Fire and Rescue Service whose team has won the World Rescue Organisation championship in Cape Town; notes that the aims of the competition are the development of skills and techniques that are used to save lives at real road accidents and the promotion of road safety; further notes that the team competed against 26 others from across the globe to take the title, in a competition that involved three simulated rescues of a casualty from an accident, in 20 minutes with full equipment, in 20 minutes with just hand tools and, finally, in just 10 minutes; also notes that the team train in its spare time and cut up over 100 cars in preparation for the competition, and wishes its members success in their endeavour to become the first team to defend the title successfully in Barcelona next year. Supported by: Alex Neil*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Sandra White*, Bruce Crawford*, Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-5152# Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions (lodged on 14 November 2006) Mr Jamie Stone*, John Swinburne*, Jackie Baillie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Cathie Craigie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Christine May*, Shiona Baird*, Bill Butler*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Brian Adam*
S2M-5152# Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions (lodged on 14 November 2006) Trish Godman*, Colin Fox*, Eleanor Scott*

S2M-5152# Cathy Peattie: Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions—That the Parliament congratulates Central Scotland Fire and Rescue Service whose team has won the World Rescue Organisation championship in Cape Town; notes that the aims of the competition are the development of skills and techniques that are used to save lives at real road accidents and the promotion of road safety; further notes that the team competed against 26 others from across the globe to take the title, in a competition that involved three simulated rescues of a casualty from an accident, in 20 minutes with full equipment, in 20 minutes with just hand tools and, finally, in just 10 minutes; also notes that the team train in its spare time and cut up over 100 cars in preparation for the competition, and wishes its members success in their endeavour to become the first team to defend the title successfully in Barcelona next year. Supported by: Alex Neil, Fiona Hyslop, Ms Sandra White, Bruce Crawford, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jamie Stone, John Swinburne, Jackie Baillie, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Cathie Craigie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Christine May, Shiona Baird, Bill Butler, Mr Frank McAveety, Brian Adam, Trish Godman, Colin Fox, Eleanor Scott, Marilyn Livingstone*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-5152# Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions (lodged on 14 November 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-5152# Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions (lodged on 14 November 2006) Karen Whitefield*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-5152# Central Scotland, World Rescue Champions (lodged on 14 November 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, Linda Fabiani*
